description: Automate Chrome pages with clicks, form fills, navigation, and in-page scripting. Inspect console and network activity, take screenshots or text snapshots, and manage multiple pages. Analyze performance with trace recordings, throttling, and Core Web Vitals insights

tools.name: list_console_messages
tools.description: List all console messages for the currently selected page since the last navigation.

tools.name: emulate_cpu
tools.description: Emulates CPU throttling by slowing down the selected page's execution.

throttlingRate.description: The CPU throttling rate representing the slowdown factor 1-20x. Set the rate to 1 to disable throttling

tools.name: emulate_network
tools.description: Emulates network conditions such as throttling or offline mode on the selected page.

throttlingOption.description: The network throttling option to emulate. Available throttling options are: No emulation, Offline, Slow 3G, Fast 3G, Slow 4G, Fast 4G. Set to "No emulation" to disable. Set to "Offline" to simulate offline network conditions.

tools.name: click
tools.description: Clicks on the provided element

uid.description: The uid of an element on the page from the page content snapshot

dblClick.description: Set to true for double clicks. Default is false.

tools.name: drag
tools.description: Drag an element onto another element

to_uid.description: The uid of the element to drop into

from_uid.description: The uid of the element to drag

tools.name: fill
tools.description: Type text into a input, text area or select an option from a <select> element.

uid.description: The uid of an element on the page from the page content snapshot

tools.name: fill_form
tools.description: Fill out multiple form elements at once

uid.description: The uid of the element to fill out

elements.description: Elements from snapshot to fill out.

tools.name: hover
tools.description: Hover over the provided element

uid.description: The uid of an element on the page from the page content snapshot

tools.name: upload_file
tools.description: Upload a file through a provided element.

uid.description: The uid of the file input element or an element that will open file chooser on the page from the page content snapshot

filePath.description: The local path of the file to upload

tools.name: get_network_request
tools.description: Gets a network request by URL. You can get all requests by calling list_network_requests.

reqid.description: The reqid of a request on the page from the listed network requests

tools.name: list_network_requests
tools.description: List all requests for the currently selected page since the last navigation.

pageIdx.description: Page number to return (0-based). When omitted, returns the first page.

pageSize.description: Maximum number of requests to return. When omitted, returns all requests.

resourceTypes.description: Filter requests to only return requests of the specified resource types. When omitted or empty, returns all requests.

tools.name: close_page
tools.description: Closes the page by its index. The last open page cannot be closed.

pageIdx.description: The index of the page to close. Call list_pages to list pages.

tools.name: handle_dialog
tools.description: If a browser dialog was opened, use this command to handle it

action.description: Whether to dismiss or accept the dialog

promptText.description: Optional prompt text to enter into the dialog.

tools.name: list_pages
tools.description: Get a list of pages open in the browser.

tools.name: navigate_page
tools.description: Navigates the currently selected page to a URL.

url.description: URL to navigate the page to

timeout.description: Maximum wait time in milliseconds. If set to 0, the default timeout will be used.

tools.name: navigate_page_history
tools.description: Navigates the currently selected page.

timeout.description: Maximum wait time in milliseconds. If set to 0, the default timeout will be used.

navigate.description: Whether to navigate back or navigate forward in the selected pages history

tools.name: new_page
tools.description: Creates a new page

url.description: URL to load in a new page.

timeout.description: Maximum wait time in milliseconds. If set to 0, the default timeout will be used.

tools.name: resize_page
tools.description: Resizes the selected page's window so that the page has specified dimension

tools.name: select_page
tools.description: Select a page as a context for future tool calls.

pageIdx.description: The index of the page to select. Call list_pages to list pages.

tools.name: performance_analyze_insight
tools.description: Provides more detailed information on a specific Performance Insight that was highlighted in the results of a trace recording.

insightName.description: The name of the Insight you want more information on. For example: "DocumentLatency" or "LCPBreakdown"

tools.name: performance_start_trace
tools.description: Starts a performance trace recording on the selected page. This can be used to look for performance problems and insights to improve the performance of the page. It will also report Core Web Vital (CWV) scores for the page.

reload.description: Determines if, once tracing has started, the page should be automatically reloaded.

autoStop.description: Determines if the trace recording should be automatically stopped.

tools.name: performance_stop_trace
tools.description: Stops the active performance trace recording on the selected page.

tools.name: take_screenshot
tools.description: Take a screenshot of the page or element.

uid.description: The uid of an element on the page from the page content snapshot. If omitted takes a pages screenshot.

format.description: Type of format to save the screenshot as. Default is "png"

quality.description: Compression quality for JPEG and WebP formats (0-100). Higher values mean better quality but larger file sizes. Ignored for PNG format.

filePath.description: The absolute path, or a path relative to the current working directory, to save the screenshot to instead of attaching it to the response.

fullPage.description: If set to true takes a screenshot of the full page instead of the currently visible viewport. Incompatible with uid.

tools.name: evaluate_script
tools.description:
Evaluate a JavaScript function inside the currently selected page. Returns the response as JSON
so returned values have to JSON-serializable.

uid.description: The uid of an element on the page from the page content snapshot

args.description: An optional list of arguments to pass to the function.

tools.name: take_snapshot
tools.description:
Take a text snapshot of the currently selected page. The snapshot lists page elements along with a unique
identifier (uid). Always use the latest snapshot. Prefer taking a snapshot over taking a screenshot.

tools.name: wait_for
tools.description: Wait for the specified text to appear on the selected page.

text.description: Text to appear on the page

timeout.description: Maximum wait time in milliseconds. If set to 0, the default timeout will be used.
